head.title: Shock Waves From the Mideast, on Two Fronts

hedline.hl1: Shock Waves From the Mideast, on Two Fronts

abstract.p: Michael J Franzblau letter on Palestinian attacks and demonizing of Israelis; suggests one-year timeout to permit Palestinian Authority to show it can govern its prople under rule of law, which would permit Israel to return to peace table with some hope of just settlement (S)

block.p: The killing of two Israeli soldiers by a Palestinian mob (front page, Oct. 13), the failure of Yasir Arafat, the Palestinian leader, to respond to the most generous offer ever made from the Israeli side in the peace talks, and the demonizing of Israelis by the media in the area controlled by the Palestinian Authority leads me to only one conclusion.

The killing of two Israeli soldiers by a Palestinian mob (front page, Oct. 13), the failure of Yasir Arafat, the Palestinian leader, to respond to the most generous offer ever made from the Israeli side in the peace talks, and the demonizing of Israelis by the media in the area controlled by the Palestinian Authority leads me to only one conclusion.

I suggest a one-year timeout to permit the Palestinian Authority to demonstrate its ability to govern its people under the rule of law, a free press, universal suffrage and an end to the corruption of its officials. This would be a confidence-building year to permit the Israelis to return to the table with some hope of a just settlement.
MICHAEL J. FRANZBLAU San Francisco, Oct. 13, 2000
